alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 28 at 2:57PM MST until December 28 at 8:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches for elevations above 7,000 ft with the highest peaks and west/southwest facing slopes seeing up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 70 mph. * WHERE...Southern Gila Highlands/Black Range County. * WHEN...From 8 AM to 8 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds and wet snow could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. Heavy snow and drifting could close highways at the higher elevations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy wet snow is expected to fall over elevations above 7000 ft, with accumulations starting around 7,500ft. Snowfall forecast 8 AM this morning through 8 PM this evening: Northern Black Range 3 to 6 inches; Pinos Altos and southern end of the Black Range 5 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visit http://nmroads.com.
